page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Neston is a small town on the Wirral Peninsula.It was mentioned in the {Domesday Book}of 1086 as being one of four places in the Wirral Hundred to support a parish priest.Its name is of Saxon origin : NES _ headland TON _ township Neston's history can be seen mainly through its buildings and customs which have survived to the present day:_e.g.the{parish church}and Neston {Ladies' Walk.}The following dates and events give us a cross-section of the area's history:- 1180_Ralph Montalt presented Neston Church to monks in Chester "for his evil deeds." 1728- a Royal Charter allowed a fair to flourish at the Cross. 1974- Neston U.D.C.was merged with the Borough of Ellesmere Port. .
